Reviews.Title: “Brief stay in April”
Reviews.Author: DJCass
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a few nights in April. We were a bit worried about the negative reviews we saw but all this was unfounded. The room was clean, the beds nice and comfortable and the bathroom was very clean. You could hear nothing at night as it was veryu quiet.The breakfast was ok, not unusual for any hotel in Italy and the bonus was it was near the station. We did not have to walk far from the station to our hotel so no dragging around bags over bridges and through crowds of people. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Tabitha M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night when my reservation at a different hotel had been cancelled, unbeknownst to myself. I told the man at the desk what had happened and he told me he had a single room with private bathroom available for 60 euros a night. Not a terrible price. I told him that I was in Venice for 4 nights but would only take the room for one until I figured things out. When I got into the room (which was difficult to find), I found it to be rather cramped and dingy. Not dirty, just old and run down. It smelled funny both in the room and in the hallways. It was quite noisy as well; I could here the people in the room next to mine as well as anyone who was walking past my room in the hallway. I really didn't want to stay there for more than one night so I headed to the tourist agency by the train station (as the hotel is about 2 minutes walk to the station) and they found me a room fairly close(more expensive, but it was well worth it). As for sleeping...the mattress and pillow were both extremely uncomfortable. I think I slept maybe 3 out of the 8 hours I was in bed. The bathroom looked quite dirty so I didn't even bother showering in the morning (thank goodness I didn't need to), just washed my face in the sink in the bedroom. I quickly packed my suitcases and headed to check out. The man at the desk looked quite confused as to why I was leaving and I told him why. I guess he must have misunderstood me and had set the room aside for the four nights I was going to be in Venice. He the proceeded to give me a lecture about how rude and inconsiderate I was. If you ask me, that is terrible customer service and no matter what, you should NEVER tell your customers that they are rude, especially after they apologize for the misunderstanding. On top of that, I paid cash (5 euros) for the city tax (1,50 euros) and he refused to give me change. After reading some of the reviews on here I'm surprised they're still in business. Some said they offered a free breakfast but that was never mentioned to me at all. If you can afford it, pay a bit extra to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fair bargain hotel, near train station”
Reviews.Author: Erwin_Widjaja
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location! The hotel is located near the St. Lucia train station, it's only ~5 mins walk away and there are many restaurants/cafes/bar nearby. Overall services are okay; the room is a bit damp. We get a room that are directly facing the street; hence there are some noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cutiepet2tie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place for the Carnevale holiday. We were there for two nights and you could NOT beat the location. My friend and I traveled by train and it seriously was right there next to the train station. If you have a lot of luggage there is no elevator. We had to hike up about 5 flights of stairs to our room, but it wasn't a problem since we only had backpacks. For only 60 Euros a night you really couldn't beat it. Breakfast wasn't bad in the morning with coffee, orange juice, croissants, proscuitto and cheese. The man clearing tables was very friendly and always made room for newcomers to the dining room. When we arrived the man greeting was very friendly and offered us a map of the city. The rooms were pretty plain and the beds were okay. It seemed pretty clean except for the mattresses, vaccums and towels that were put in storage in random spots in the hallway. For the money we paid, I couldn't have asked for better.

Reviews.Title: “No vale la pena”
Reviews.Author: diseï¿½ï¿½adora
Reviews.Content: El hotel se encuentra ubicado junto a la estacion del tren, o sea lejisimos del centro de Venecia. Esta lejos de TODO, incluso lejos de los supermercados. El hotel no cuenta con ascensor, y hay que subir muchisimos pisos por escalera. El hotel es sucio, feo, incomodo. Nuestro aire acondicionado no servia y era pleno verano. El desayuno era incomible, la vajilla estaba sucia. La gente nos atendio bien, pero el personal es insuficiente para atender un hotel completo. Tienen un solo bell boy, o sea que era imposible que nos ayudara para subir las maletas por las escaleras.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location with friendly staff but little mismanaged”
Reviews.Author: amogharya
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two nights and I would not recommend it very highly. The one positive thing was that it is situated very near to railway station. So if you are arriving in venice with train it is well located and would save you from towing your luggage with you inside the narrow streets of venice. The staff was friendly, we arrived the hotel little early so it allowed us to keep our belongings in the hotel without check in. The most striking negative thing was mismanagement in room allocation and cleanliness but it would like to attribute it to the over crowded vacation season. Overall a good place to stay for small time.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Danny S
Reviews.Content: I returned from this hotel just days ago and I would never go back. Beds are soft and lumpy. You feel as if you are not safe. Dirty laundry in the halls night and day. Gross Breakfast!! Staff is rude and very unhelpful. Hair on clean sheets and a light fixture that was dusty and had cobwebs. Plus the light only had three working bulbs out of eight. We were told this was a three star hotel?? Not even on the star map. Spend more money and stay somewhere much better.

Reviews.Title: “We spent the night with one eye open”
Reviews.Author: Cirton
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever been to. Our room was on the ground floor and the windows would not lock we spent the night worried that we would be robbed...it was not safe... We moved our bed against the door so that we felt safer. Breakfast included warm yogurt and bad coffee. This place stunk, stay away

Reviews.Title: “Service is terrible - we are never going back!”
Reviews.Author: zainabns
Reviews.Content: The hotel is drab and the rooms are stuffy and small. Cleanliness is just about ok and the breakfast is limited and the quality of their food is average. However what really put us off was the terrible service at the front desk. We had requested for a cup of hot water during the day as one of our family was feeling unwell. A staff member brought us a cup and then asked us to leave it in the restaurant area (on the ground floor near the reception) on our way out. When my sister did so, the front office manager (an elderly man) began shouting at her and saying she was not allowed in that area. When we explained (patiently) why she had done so, it didn't help at all. He called the staff member in question and fired him as well! On the whole he made us feel like thieves - and all for a cup of hot water! Will never ever go back. And neither should anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH OUT FOR THE BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: rudmanhb
Reviews.Content: I have said that we stayed in March 2010 but in fact it was April 2009 and I did not realise we could comment on our stay. The fact is that finally our travel agent gave us credit on this hotel because of the apalling stay. The first night was ok we had one of the two balcony apartments. Returning after our cruise we were given different rooms, on checking into one of them we nearly threw up as it reeked of urine so we asked for another and were given two other rooms around the back that were reasonable clean but still stank. The main problem was that when I awoke in the morningn I had these huge bed bug bvites all over my back. Even took a photo to prove it". The staff were arrogant, unhelpful and rude. People nowe ask what we thought of Venice "we respond "hated it, revolting". The hotel was not even that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have been to”
Reviews.Author: elle194
Reviews.Content: To get to our rooms you had to go through the laundry room. I have never met such a rude receptionist. He shouted at four different members of our group on separate occasions for simple things as asking for a glass of water, an extra blanket during the night as the rooms were freezing, the codes for the internet access as there was a sign saying 'wifi available' and turns out there was none. The hotel puts down its shutters at 1.30am so you cant get in or out of the hotel after this which is not only ridiculous but a fire hazard. We were told breakfast finished at 8.30am which again is ridiculous. They were rude, unhelpful and the hotel was cold and old fashioned. The shower was freezing and overall a bad experience. I have worked in a hotel for two years and been to many throughout europe and could not get over the poor quality of this hotel. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Clean - too many tenagers students”
Reviews.Author: LisbonRudi
Reviews.Content: Late â€“ very late revue. I was in this hotel in March 2009. not as is is posted Basically, it was used by teenager students. They stay in the rooms in the front of the hotel â€“ where the noise is. I got a room in the back (see photos) +- 50 mtrs. Room was quiet, far from the front desk, far from noise. Very simple room, no luxury at all. Breakfast â€“ all the kids were there from 7.30 until 8.00 â€“ not a lots of choiceâ€™s in food. Room â€“ Clean and no luxury â€“ an old TV with 7 channels â€“ 4 Italians Toilet â€“ Clean â€“ AND I LIKE THAT A LOT â€“ but you can see the pipes for the water etc. Reception â€“ Ok â€“ no problems Location â€“ Very Good Tips â€“ Restaurant next door â€“ cheap, very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, price and staff”
Reviews.Author: ACMMM
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one Saturday night (used booking.com). The location could not be any better for anyone who has never been in Venice (or Italy). I emailed the staff with questions, which were answered promptly. It was indeed 90 seconds walk from the St. Lucia train station. After check-in, the front desk person gave me directions and tips on catching an early flight next day. I had a great time in the city and the hotel was part of it. It is no-frill but for a solo traveler who did not have much time, this worked out perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: tastydelight
Reviews.Content: We walked from the train station to this sweet hotel with no reservation. It was one block off the grand canal, and only 120 euros with breakfast. After Rome, we were thrilled. It is a no frills hotel, but clean and friendly, with a decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Daytime Reception Staff Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pattiesplum
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night to a grumpy receptionist who chatted to a friend all the time he was checking us in mumbled about breakfast and check out and pointed vaguely in the direction of our room. Other guest helped us find room on top floor up 3 flights of stairs. Room and bathroom very clean , bed comfy. Next morning opened the shutters to the large window and room filled with light- changed the feel of the room completely. Breakfast was good and staff very helpful. ( I did take my own English Tea Bags). The two male members of staff on reception in the morning were totally opposite to the night staff and could not have been more helpful of friendly. Did not spend much time in the hotel only to sleep and have breakfast as there is so much to see and do in Venice - a wonderful city. This hotel is great if you want a clean comfy place to sleep which is not expensive and do not require room service etc. Do not let the welcome you get from the night receptionist put you of this hotel but you must be prepared to climb stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: besimabdullai
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very close to the Train Station and very good starting point for different trips around the isles. The staff was very Friendly and the food was great in the morning. Air conditioning was functioning all the time, we had TV and deep cooler in the Room, always we had warm water and regularly the Room was cleaned. I prefer to the people with middle income and not very high budget, because for the price was worth.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely lower than 3*”
Reviews.Author: rkabbara
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very old. Rooms are small. furniture is old, and the bathroom doesn't have a hand towel! The hotel doesn't have a lift. Overall, the hotel cannot be a 3* one. It's absolutely lower than that. I was also shocked when the receptionist told me that the hotel closes the door at 1:00 a.m.!!!! The location was good because it's inside the island and close to the main train station but pretty far from San Marco Piazza.

Reviews.Title: “Is ok if you are just staying for 1-2nites.”
Reviews.Author: hweitze
Reviews.Content: Furniture looks old but room quite spacious and facilities in good condition. Breakfast is adequate. Consider good location - near train station, you have cafe/eat places around . One of the cheaper hotel around the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4travelers_2
Reviews.Content: We booked several hotels using the reviews of travelers for our trip. This was the first hotel that disappointed us on all levels. We are not fussy people and do not travel first class, but I think a 3 star rating is not correct on this hotel. Lobby is extremely depressing to enter. Furniture lined up in rows, no tables, old cracked mirrors. This was our first impression and it went downhill from there. Check in clerk was not very friendly and when son inquired about internet access (even though it says it is available in hotel), clerk pointed and said "Down the road 100 meters". The route to room got us ready for the twisting, turning alleys in Venice. We thought we would need a map to find our way there. No elevator service, but there was a bagboy who carried everything (God Bless him). Room was depressing also. Loose tiles on floors, drab colors, room needed to be painted. We had a family room with 1 double, 2 twins. Double mattress was the most uncomfortable bed I have ever slept in. It was mattress on metal spring frame (no boxspring). I thought I was back at summer camp. There was AC in room, but controls were limited, so we either froze or had to shut it off. The only good thing about the room was a recently updated bathroom. However on first day, when we went to take showers at 8:00-there was no hot water. Breakfast was really poor-stale rolls and croissants, liquid yogurt, coffee machine dispensed 6 different things and coffee was undrinkable. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that it is close to train station and has a gelato stand right at entrance. The Ferrova water taxi is right outside also, so it made getting to St. Mark's Square easy. We loved everything about Venice except this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't hate it”
Reviews.Author: 2008Liz
Reviews.Content: After the old bait and switch routine landed us at the Universo Nord Hotel (see my write-up of the Hotel Martee e Biasin for the backstory), we were prepared for the worst. Let's start with the best part of this hotel: the staff. The hotel staff was the friendliest and most pleasant of all the ones we encountered on our 10 day trip, during which we stayed at The Cadogan in London, the Hotel Majestic Roma in Rome, the Hotel Bernini Bristol also in Rome and the Plaza Lucchesi in Florence. Although those were all higher end hotels, the service and attitude of the staff at those establishments could not hold a candle to the staff at the Universo Nord Hotel. It was the only time we felt so genuinely welcome and that the staff was not miserable, but seemed to thoroughly enjoy their jobs! Other positive aspects of the hotel are that it is a stone's throw from the train station and they charged us 98 euros for a triple (since that is the price we booked at the other hotel). I think their usual rate is slightly higher. Beyond that, the hotel was a bit depressing. We had to walk up a maze of stairs to find our room, which was threadbare. The room was made up of a double bed, a separate twin bed, a tiny tv that didn't work, a closet and the equally tiny bathroom. The shower (no bath) barely fit my boyfriend and it had this weird design where to get in, you had to slide two doors that met at the corner of the shower away from each other. I don't know if that makes sense, but if you ever see it, you'll know what I mean. Don't go for the breakfast unless you're desperate. There was a really scary coffee machine, and equally scary juice machine, cured meats and cheeses that looked crusty around the edges and some stale bread. I guess this hotel was a good value given the prices in Venice, but truth be told, it was kind of a bummer way to end our Italian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scottie89
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our third stay in this hotel. As ever, efficient and friendly receptionists, enough breakfast to keep some people going all day, (some did with their takeaway, mostly Orientals and North Americans). The room was clean and tidy, and was cleaned and changed daily. There was an apology for the room being on the top floor, no lift, but the room more than made up for the exertion; a terrace with a view over to the Scalzi Bridge and the Grand Canal. The hotel is convenient for the raiway station, bus terminal and vaperetto stop. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very GOOD hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kano86
Reviews.Content: I can't understand why there are bad reviews on this hotel. I have stayed in the hotel and I can only say that I was totally satisfied with the service. it is an EXCELLENT hotel. The service is good. The receptionists are friendly and helpful. When I arrived, I gave the receptionist my name, and without checking on his computer and stuff, he impressed me by saying "oh, yes, we've been expecting you." since they are a small hotel, they actually remember who are the guests they are expecting to come everyday. And when I was queueing on an ATM machine nearby the hotel, one of the receptionist (who was having a cigarette break) actually approached me and told me that there is another ATM machine nearby that most tourists don't know so there's no line there. Those are nice friendly touch that you don't get in most hotels. There are no lift, but the little staircases gives a certain romantic touch to the hotel, makes you really feel that you're staying in a sweet little venetian house. Don't worry about your luggage, there is a bellboy who carries your luggage to your room (a service which doesn't usually exist in 3* hotel). The room is nicely furnished with clean white furniture, well-heated. The bathroom is clean, with clean towels everyday, and a hairdryer. The breakfast impressed me. Having stayed in other Italian 3* hotels, I was expecting simple croissant, jam and cheese. But besides the basic breads, croissant, cereal, jam, cheese, juices, tea coffee, chocolate, they also serve ham and salami. Lastly, I think its location is excellent. It's 5 minutes walk from the train station and from the bus terminal. lots of nice affordable trattorias and food stalls. And since venice is pretty small, you can actually just walk to everywhere! All in all, I am very happy with the hotel, and if you're going to venice, I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I have EVER stayed”
Reviews.Author: Schtep
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough against this awful place. I have been all over the world from campsites and hostels in Africa and Asia, all over Europe - I lived in Italy for three years and know Venice well, so I know what else is out there and how badly this place compares. Our bed was not for two people but one and a half sized, but we just thought we could put up with it for one night and went out for a pizza. When we returned there was a slightly bad smell in the room, so we opened the window and went to bed. At two in the morning we both woke up retching, and figured out that the sewage tank or similar was right outside our window and the stench was worse than being in a long-drop privy for the night. There was no where to move us to. We closed the window but the air con didn't do anything and the smell pervaded the wall and window anyway. I found the staff unhelpful except for before and during payment on arrival. We paid well over the odds for this dreadful experience. Do NOT stay here. Instead, go around the corner to the wonderful Alloggi Gerotto Calderan where I have stayed many times but were full on this occasion. That place says it's a hostel but is actually a nice little hotel. This place says it's a 3* and doesn't deserve one.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay again”
Reviews.Author: tswalker226
Reviews.Content: 1. Rude front desk people 2. Very small room 3. TV didn't work 4. Smallest shower I've ever seen 5. Hair dryer didn't work 6. Decent location - close to train station and not a far walk to sites 7. We saw the breakfast and left to eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but some rude staff members during the night shift.”
Reviews.Author: Guatemalantraveler
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel has a great location, it is close to the train station, the restaurants around are the last to close at night, which is very convenient. I paid only 80 euros for a small, one single bed room, it was clean, with a t.v., mini fridge and A.C. The staff during the day were very nice, friendly and helpfull. Breakfast is included. Everything sounds perfect so far, but you have to be prepared for the man who works in the night shift!, he is the rudest person you can imagine!. One night I took my room key with me, and when I came back he screamed at me telling me I had to leave the key at the front desk. The second night he screamed at me when I asked him if one of my friends was at his room, he thought I was not a guest so he told me he gave that information only to the police. The third night he screamed at me again when I was walking out for dinner, he told me in a rude way not to come back after 12 because he was closing the gates, by then I Iost my temper and I screamed back to him, and we ended up having a strong argument. The last night a very nice guy was in the night shift, perhaps other guest had the same problems as me and he was removed. Having someone yelling at you every night after you had a great day at Venice is not nice. If the bitter guy in the night shift is gone you will enjoy this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: funpeopleConnaught
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews, we were a little apprehensive entering this hotel. It looks a little shabby from the outside. However our stay couldn't have been better (apart from all the stairs we had to climb), the staff were excellent with great english. One gentleman even walked us to a restaurant when we asked for a good place to eat. Yes the building is old and quaint even! But it had airconditioning, clean rooms, nice breakfast, what more could we ask for? At that price it is a steal. And it's just a stones throw away from the train station. I would definetly stay there again if I was in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “High priced hostel”
Reviews.Author: gigabyte_me
Reviews.Content: I am not a fussy traveller and I have stayed at many budget accomodations throughout Europe, the States and Australia. Therefore, I didn't mind that the hotel gave me the usual 'pay up front' demand and the usual 'credit machine broken, only cash accepted' excuse. I also didn't mind that on check-in, the room wasn't made up. Cigarette butts on the floor, dirty sink, towels and sheets. Went out for sightseeing and returned to find it cleaned. Also, didn't mind that there are no elevators in this 'hotel'. What bothered me was that the hotel locks its gates after midnight without volunteering that information on check in. I came back at half past 12 on the first night to find it locked and no one was manning the lobby. The staff who eventually let me in was rude and never apologised. The following day, another hotel staff explained that because they are a 3 star hotel, they lock the front gate at night. Checked with other 3 and 2 star hotels in the vicinity and was told that 'they don't lock the doors until all guests have returned'. Not the case with Hotel Universo. So make sure you adhere to the curfew. This is more of a high priced pensione or hostel than a hotel. Oh, and that hotel staff who begrudingly opened the gate for me that night, on the day of my check-out, he told me rudely, ganging up with his colleague that it was my fault I got locked out and that it was not a big deal because I didn't have to wait more than 5 - 10 minutes. Wouldn't stay there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Lycheeice
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel in Venice based on the price and location. My companion and I took the bus from the airport into Venice, and the ride was only ~25 mins (3 euro each person). We stayed in Venice for one night and had to head out the next morning by train, so this hotel location was perfect because it was only a block away from the train station (St. Lucia), and not too far from the bus station (Piazzale Roma). The staff was nice, and they let us leave our luggage with with them since we arrived before check-in time. The room itself was clean but small. We had a room facing the back alley so no view for us. However, we didn't mind since we only spent minimal amount of time in the room. We didn't have a lot of time in the morning, so didn't get to try the breakfast. One complain about the room was that the the water pipe must be near the bed, and we can hear upstairs flushing the toilet.... Overall, this is an ok hotel choice if you are on a budget and need easy access to transportation. However, if you are looking for something more unique and wouldn't mind spending a few more bucks then I would suggest you look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; other than that, so-so hotel”
Reviews.Author: JessBeth
Reviews.Content: The Universo Nord Hotel could not be in a more convenient (or kitschy/touristy) location--just about a block from the train station. From that perspective, it was very convenient--we didn't have far to go with our suitcases. That being said, the hotel has seen better days. I know Venice is expensive, but we paid about $200 for a spare room with no amenities or creature comforts, and everything seemed a little bit shabby. The selling point of the room was that it was at the back of the hotel, off the main (and very noisy) street. I would recommend this hotel for convenience only; we passed many other small hotels that looked much more appealing than this one.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: OttawaWest
Reviews.Content: The experience on the whole was negative, thanks to very rude behaviour by one particular individual on the check-in staff. When we arrived, the hotel did not have our reservations (although we had pre-paid two months prior). The individual immediately got defensive and insulted both myself and my wife calling us "stupid Americans" despite us being "stupid Canadians" - but I digress. I felt we were more than reasonable people during the entire affair, in both our attitudes and position, with the staff. We stood our ground and a room was "granted" to us - we were continuously verbally abused during the check-in process by the particular individual. As in many three star hotels in Italy, the room was certainly not perfectly clean, with mildew all over the bathroom, stained carpets, etc. However, at the end of the day, it wasn't, in relative terms, a horrible hotel to come back to at the end of the night and things could have been a lot worse. Other staff members were nice enough. The breakfast was half-decent for a Venice hotel, with some deli meats and cheeses, but overall, fairly poor. Overall, Venice is a city that isn't too interested in making sure you have a good time. I'd say this hotel is a perfect example of the Venetian attitude towards most tourists.

HotelInfo.Name: Universo Nord Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio Lista di Spagna 121, 30121 Venice, Italy
